item.title: Lessons from Grading Graduate Work as an Undergrad: 01
item.description: Intro Through a short series of bureaucratic happenstances, I find myself grading for a graduate-level machine learning course as an undergraduate. I excelled in my undergraduate machine learning course and the curriculum is essentially the same. Nonetheless, I expect some interesting tidbits may be gleaned from the experience. Part 1 Technical Stuff In my first grading experience for the course, I have already learned or re-learned a few interesting things of a technical nature.

item.title: Iris: The Hello World of Data Science
item.description: Iris The famous Iris data set is the ‘Hello World’ of data science. It’s small enough to be easy to understand at a glance, but large enough to have some interesting and demonstrative properties. It’s great for exploring predictive and classification models, for regression and clustering and for unsupervised and supervised machine learning techniques. Iris is just fun and colorful in a way that appeals to the kid in all of us.
